content:
TITLE: Configuring Root pubspec.yaml for Melos Workspace
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for the root pubspec.yaml file that defines a Dart workspace with multiple packages and specifies the Dart SDK version requirement.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_project
publish_to: none
environment:
  sdk: ^3.6.0
workspace:
  - packages/helper
  - packages/client_package
  - packages/server_package
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Basic melos.yaml Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example of a basic melos.yaml configuration file that defines the project name and specifies which package directories to include in the workspace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_project

packages:
  - apps/**
  - packages/**
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Root pubspec.yaml for Melos 7.x Workspace
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for the root pubspec.yaml file in a Melos workspace, showing workspace package declarations and melos configuration setup. Requires Dart SDK 3.6.0 or newer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_workspace
publish_to: none
environment:
  sdk: ^3.6.0
workspace:
  - packages/helper
  - packages/client_package
  - packages/server_package
dev_dependencies:
  melos: ^7.0.0

melos:
  # All of the content of your previous melos.yaml file
  # (Except for the packages and name)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Melos Programmatically in Dart
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use Melos commands programmatically by importing the Melos package in Dart code. Shows initializing Melos and calling bootstrap and publish methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
final melos = Melos(workingDirectory: Directory.current);

await melos.bootstrap();
await melos.publish(dryRun: false);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Recommended Monorepo Directory Structure with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Example of the recommended directory structure for a Melos workspace, showing the organization of apps and packages with configuration files at the root.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
my_project
â”œâ”€â”€ apps
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ apps_1
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ apps_2
â”œâ”€â”€ packages
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ package_1
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ package_2
â”œâ”€â”€ melos.yaml
â”œâ”€â”€ pubspec.yaml
â””â”€â”€ README.md
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Bootstrapping a Melos Workspace
DESCRIPTION: Command to bootstrap a Melos workspace, which installs dependencies, syncs shared dependencies between packages, and runs any bootstrap lifecycle scripts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos bootstrap
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Melos globally using Dart Pub
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Melos as a global package via pub.dev so it can be used from anywhere on your system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
dart pub global activate melos
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Melos Bootstrap Command in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Basic usage of the Melos bootstrap command with its shorthand alternative. This command initializes the workspace and installs dependencies across all packages in the monorepo.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/bootstrap.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos bootstrap
# or
melos bs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Post-Bootstrap Lifecycle Script in melos.yaml
DESCRIPTION: Configuring a post-bootstrap hook that automatically runs after bootstrap completes. This example shows how to run build_runner to generate code after dependencies are installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/bootstrap.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# melos.yaml
# ...
command:
  bootstrap:
    hooks:
      post: dart pub run build_runner build
# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Publishing Packages to pub.dev
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to publish versioned packages to pub.dev by using the melos publish command with the --no-dry-run flag to perform an actual publish.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/guides/automated-releases.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
melos publish --no-dry-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Melos Exec Script in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure a script to be executed in multiple packages using the 'exec' option, with a simple command example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/scripts.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
scripts:
  hello:
    exec: echo 'Hello $(dirname $PWD)'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Scripts in melos.yaml
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining a custom script in melos.yaml that runs build_runner across all packages that depend on it, with concurrency limited to 1.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_project

packages:
  - apps/**
  - packages/**

scripts:
  generate:
    run: melos exec -c 1 --depends-on build_runner -- dart run build_runner build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Melos Workspace Directory Structure
DESCRIPTION: Example of the standard directory structure for a Melos workspace, showing the root pubspec.yaml and package organization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
my-melos-repo/
  pubspec.yaml
  packages/
    package-1/
      pubspec.yaml
    package-2/
      pubspec.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Packages by Git Diff with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Filter packages based on changes between Git commits using the --diff flag. This can target packages that changed between a specific commit and HEAD or within a range of commits using Git's shorthand syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Run `flutter build ios` on all packages that are different between current
# branch and the specified commit hash.
melos exec --diff=<commit hash> -- flutter build ios

# Run `flutter build ios` on all packages that are different between remote
# `main` branch and HEAD.
melos exec --diff=origin/main...HEAD -- flutter build ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Simple Melos Script in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define a basic script named 'hello' in the Melos configuration of pubspec.yaml. The script simply echoes 'Hello World'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/scripts.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
melos:
  scripts:
    hello: echo 'Hello World'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Including Package Dependencies with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Expand the filtered list of packages to include their transitive dependencies using the --include-dependencies flag. This ensures all required packages are included regardless of other filters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos list --scope=some_package --include-dependencies
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Package pubspec.yaml for Workspace Resolution
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to configure a package's pubspec.yaml to use workspace resolution, enabling package dependencies to be resolved within the monorepo.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_package
resolution: workspace

...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Arbitrary Commands with Melos Exec
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the 'melos exec' command to run arbitrary commands in each package. The example shows running a pub global command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/exec.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos exec
# e.g. melos exec -- pub global run tuneup check
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Melos Bootstrap Command for Changed Packages
DESCRIPTION: Example of combining the bootstrap command with filtering options to only bootstrap packages that have changed since a specific branch.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/bootstrap.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Only bootstrap packages that have
# changed since the main branch.
melos bootstrap --diff="main"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Melos as a Development Dependency
DESCRIPTION: Command to add Melos as a development dependency to the root project, ensuring all developers use the same version of Melos.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
dart pub add melos --dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Packages by Category with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Filter packages based on categories declared in the melos.yaml file using the --category flag. This allows grouping packages by purpose or type and targeting specific groups with commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Run `flutter build ios` on all packages in the "examples" category.
melos exec --category="examples" -- flutter build ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Multi-Step Melos Script in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to define a complex script with multiple steps, combining simple commands and Melos commands with specific arguments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/scripts.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
scripts:
  pre-commit:
    description: pre-commit git hook script
    steps:
      - echo 'hello world'
      - format --output none --set-exit-if-changed
      - analyze --fatal-infos
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Version Command Hooks in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to set up a preCommit hook for the version command in the melos.yaml configuration file. This hook allows for custom actions before the version commit is created.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/version.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
command:
  version:
    hooks:
      preCommit: |
        # Make changes to the version commit here.
        # You need to stage changes that you make yourself.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Packages by File Existence with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Include only packages where a specific file exists in the package using the --file-exists flag. This can target packages containing particular configuration or documentation files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Only bootstrap packages with an README.md file
melos bootstrap --file-exists="README.md"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Extended Melos Script in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Shows an extended script configuration named 'hello' with additional properties like name, description, run command, and environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/scripts.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
scripts:
  hello:
    name: hey
    description: Greet the world
    run: echo '$GREETING World'
    env:
      GREETING: 'Hey'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Flutter Clean Post-Clean Hook
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring a post-clean hook to run 'flutter clean' in all Flutter packages with concurrency control.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/clean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# melos.yaml
# ...
command:
  clean:
    hooks:
      # Runs "flutter clean" in all Flutter packages (`--flutter`)
      # with a concurrency of 3 at a time (`--concurrency=3`).
      post: melos exec --flutter --concurrency=3 -- "flutter clean"
# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Shared Dependencies in melos.yaml
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for shared dependencies across packages. This ensures consistent dependency versions throughout the monorepo by defining them centrally in the melos.yaml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/bootstrap.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# melos.yaml
# ...
command:
  bootstrap:
    environment:
      sdk: ">=3.0.0 <4.0.0"
      flutter: ">=3.0.0 <4.0.0"
    dependencies:
      collection: ^1.18.0
      integral_isolates: any
      uni_links2:
      uni_links_macos:
        git: https://github.com/SamJakob/uni_links_macos.git
    
    dev_dependencies:
      build_runner: ^2.3.3
# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Package pubspec.yaml for Melos Workspace
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for individual package pubspec.yaml files in a Melos workspace, showing the required workspace resolution setting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_package
environment:
  sdk: ^3.6.0
resolution: workspace
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Melos Version Command in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Basic usage of the 'melos version' command to automatically version and generate changelogs for all packages in a Melos project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/version.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Melos Publish Hooks Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration example showing how to set up pre and post publish hooks in melos.yaml.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/publish.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# melos.yaml
# ...
command:
  publish:
    hooks:
      pre: dart pub run build_runner build
      post: dart pub run build_runner clean
# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Melos Publish Dry Run Options
DESCRIPTION: Examples showing how to use Melos publish with and without dry-run mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/publish.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Publish packages with dry run
melos publish --dry-run

# Publish packages without dry run
melos publish --no-dry-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Melos Run Command
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the basic usage of the 'melos run' command to execute a script defined in the workspace 'melos.yaml' configuration file. The <name> parameter should be replaced with the actual script name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/run.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos run <name>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Packages by Name Pattern with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Include only packages with names matching a specific glob pattern using the --scope flag. This option can be used multiple times to include packages matching different patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Run `flutter build ios` on all packages with "example" in the package name
melos exec --scope="*example*" -- flutter build ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Melos Publish with Git Tag Version
DESCRIPTION: Command to publish packages with git tag version creation enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/publish.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos publish --no-dry-run --git-tag-version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Packages by Dependencies with Melos
DESCRIPTION: Include only packages that depend on specific dependencies using the --depends-on flag. This option can be repeated to filter packages that depend on multiple dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/filters.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos exec --depends-on="flutter" --depends-on="firebase_core" -- flutter test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Fail-Fast Option with Melos Exec
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the '--fail-fast' option with 'melos exec'. This option stops execution in further packages if the script fails in any individual package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/exec.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Fail fast
melos exec --fail-fast -- "dart analyze ."
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Multiple Commands with Melos Exec
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to execute multiple commands using 'melos exec'. Commands are connected with '&&' to ensure they run sequentially and stop if one fails.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/exec.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
melos exec -- "melos bootstrap && melos run build"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Package pubspec.yaml for Melos 7.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Example of a package's pubspec.yaml file after migrating to Melos 7.x.x. It demonstrates the required 'resolution: workspace' configuration needed to enable pub workspaces integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/packages/melos/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_package
environment:
  sdk: ^3.6.0
resolution: workspace
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fresh Start Cleaning Workflow
DESCRIPTION: A common pattern to give your workspace a fresh start by cleaning and then bootstrapping again.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/clean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos clean
melos bootstrap
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Root pubspec.yaml for Melos 7.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration for the root pubspec.yaml file after migrating to Melos 7.x.x, showing how to define workspace packages and include melos configuration that was previously in melos.yaml.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/guides/migrations.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
name: my_workspace
publish_to: none
environment:
  sdk: ^3.6.0
workspace:
  - packages/helper
  - packages/client_package
  - packages/server_package
dev_dependencies:
  melos: ^7.0.0

melos:
  # All of the content of your previous melos.yaml file
  # (Except for the packages and name)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing a Melos Workspace with Basic Command
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the basic usage of the 'init' command in Melos. It allows you to initialize a new Melos workspace with an optional workspace name.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/init.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos init [workspace_name]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Melos Version Command for Manual Versioning
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the melos version command to manually version a single package by specifying the package name and desired version change.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/guides/automated-releases.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
melos version <package-name> <version-change>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Package Filters for Melos Script in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use packageFilters to restrict script execution to specific packages, in this case, only Flutter packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/scripts.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
scripts:
  hello_flutter:
    exec: echo 'Hello $(dirname $PWD)'
    packageFilters:
      flutter: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Melos Clean Command
DESCRIPTION: Basic usage of the clean command to remove temporary pub and generated Melos IDE files from the workspace and packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/clean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos clean
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Melos Command Hooks in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure pre and post hooks for Melos commands, using the bootstrap command as an example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/scripts.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
command:
  bootstrap:
    hooks:
      pre: echo `bootstrap command is running...`
      post: echo `bootstrap command is done`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Melos List Command Usage
DESCRIPTION: The basic command to list information about the local packages in a Melos workspace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/list.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos list
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Controlling Changelog Generation in Melos Version Command
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using the --changelog/-c flag to enable or disable CHANGELOG.md file updates based on conventional commit messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/version.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos version --changelog
melos version -c
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Melos Run Command with No-Select Option
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the '--no-select' option with the 'melos run' command. This option skips the prompt to select a package, but still applies filters defined in the script's 'packageFilters' options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/run.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos run <name> --no-select
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Repository URL in Melos
DESCRIPTION: Defines the URL of the git repository containing the Melos workspace. Supports GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and Azure DevOps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/overview.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
melos:
  repository: https://github.com/invertase/melos
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Melos CLI Help Command Output
DESCRIPTION: Shows the output of running 'melos --help' which lists all available commands and options for the Melos CLI tool, including bootstrap, clean, exec, format, list, publish, run, and version commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/packages/melos/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
> melos --help

A CLI tool for managing Dart & Flutter projects with multiple packages.

Usage: melos <command> [arguments]

Global options:
-h, --help        Print this usage information.
    --verbose     Enable verbose logging.
    --sdk-path    Path to the Dart/Flutter SDK that should be used. This command line option has
                  precedence over the `sdkPath` option in the root `pubspec.yaml` configuration
                  file and the `MELOS_SDK_PATH` environment variable. To use the system-wide SDK,
                  provide the special value "auto".

Available commands:
  bootstrap   Initialize the workspace, link local packages together and install remaining package
              dependencies. Supports all package filtering options.
  clean       Clean this workspace and all packages. This deletes the temporary pub & ide files such
              as ".packages" & ".flutter-plugins". Supports all package filtering options.
  exec        Execute an arbitrary command in each package. Supports all package filtering options.
  format      Idiomatically format Dart source code.
  list        List local packages in various output formats. Supports all package filtering options.
  publish     Publish any unpublished packages or package versions in your repository to pub.dev. Dry
              run is on by default.
  run         Run a script by name defined in the workspace pubspec.yaml config file.
  version     Automatically version and generate changelogs based on the Conventional Commits
              specification. Supports all package filtering options.

Run "melos help <command>" for more information about a command.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Post-Clean Lifecycle Script
DESCRIPTION: Example of adding a post-clean hook in melos.yaml to remove specific generated files after the clean command is executed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/clean.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# melos.yaml
# ...
command:
  clean:
    hooks:
      post: rm packages/foo/lib/src/generated_file.g.dart
# ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Finding Dependency Cycles in Workspace
DESCRIPTION: Detects and reports cycles in package dependencies, which can help identify circular dependencies that could cause problems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/list.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos list --cycles
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Ignoring Packages in Melos
DESCRIPTION: Specifies paths to local packages that should be excluded from the Melos workspace using glob patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/configuration/overview.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
ignore:
  # e.g. ignore example apps
  - 'packages/**/example'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Package Information as JSON
DESCRIPTION: Shows package information as a formatted JSON array, which is useful for programmatic processing of package data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/docs/commands/list.mdx#2025-04-16_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
melos list --json
```

TITLE: Parsing Conventional Commits in Dart
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the ConventionalCommit class to parse a git commit message. It extracts various components such as description, body, type, scopes, breaking changes, and footers from the commit message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/invertase/melos/blob/main/packages/conventional_commit/README.md#2025-04-16_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dart
CODE:
```
import 'package:conventional_commit/conventional_commit.dart';

const commitMessageExample = '''
feat(cool): An exciting new feature.

A body describing this commit in more detail.

The body in this example is multi-line.

BREAKING CHANGE: This is a breaking change because of X Y Z.

Co-authored-by: @Salakar
Refs #123 #456
''';

void main() {
  final parsedCommit = ConventionalCommit.parse(commitMessageExample);

  print(parsedCommit.description);
  // : An exciting new feature.

  print(parsedCommit.body);
  // : A body describing this commit in more detail.
  // :
  // : The body in this example is multi-line.

  print(parsedCommit.type);
  // : feat

  print(parsedCommit.scopes);
  // : ['cool']

  print(parsedCommit.isBreakingChange);
  // : true

  print(parsedCommit.breakingChangeDescription);
  // : This is a breaking change because of X Y Z.

  print(parsedCommit.footers);
  // : ['Co-authored-by: @Salakar', 'Refs #123 #456']

  print(parsedCommit.isMergeCommit);
  // : false
}
```
